etymologies: Old English wermōd. The change in spelling in late Middle English was due to association with worm and wood. Compare with vermouth

definitions: a woody shrub with a bitter aromatic taste, used as an ingredient of vermouth and absinthe and in medicine.

notes.text: Genus rtemisia, family Compositae: several species, in particular the Eurasian A. absinthium

shortDefinitions: woody shrub with bitter aromatic taste

definitions: a state or source of bitterness or grief.
shortDefinitions: state or source of bitterness or grief
